info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:04AM EDT until June 14 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FOR HARRISON...SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHERN CARROLL...CENTRAL BELMONT AND EASTERN TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 104 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Carrollton to 7 miles southeast of Cadiz to 6 miles east of Barnesville, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Trees snapped and uprooted. Power outages can be expected. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, St. Clairsville, Cadiz, Dennison, Gnadenhutten, Bethesda, Tuscarawas, Hopedale, Flushing, and Smithfield. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
